alert.note: Alert for Elko; Eureka (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 05 at 12:42PM PST until March 05 at 1:30PM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: The National Weather Service in Elko Nevada has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... South central Elko County in northeastern Nevada... Northern Eureka County in north central Nevada... * Until 130 PM PST. * At 1239 PM PST, a pair of dangerous snow squalls are located along a line extending from near Deeth to 11 miles west of Jiggs, and along Adobe Range west of the city of Elko moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. Locations impacted include... Elko, Carlin, South Fork, Pine Valley, Lee, Jiggs, Lamoille, Deeth, Ryndon, Emigrant Pass, Spring Creek, Palisade, Adobe Summit, Lamoille Summit, Lamoille Canyon, Emigrant Mine, South Area Mine, Star Valley and Halleck. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT
